Canadian rent vs mortgage. Positive cross price elasticity for housing (mortgage payments) and rental demand (>1) suggests elasticity and the + indicates they're substitutes. A rise in mortgage costs leads to a larger surge in rental demand more than the change in mortgage cost.

The average asking price for a Canadian rental unit hit a record high of $2,042 in June, adding more hurdles to our ongoing housing crisis. The 1.4% increase in rents from May represented the fastest month-over-month increase so far this year.
